thread.title: Extra hours for voter registration announced in Niagara County
thread.title_full: Extra hours for voter registration announced in Niagara County - City & Region - The Buffalo News

author: buffalonews
title: Extra hours for voter registration announced in Niagara County
text:
LOCKPORT – The Niagara County Board of Elections will offer some extra office hours for those looking to register to vote for the Nov. 3 general election.
The deadline for new voters to register is Oct. 9, and those who have moved since the last time they voted must re-register by that date. That’s also the deadline to change party affiliation for 2016.
The election office at 11 Main St., Lockport, normally open from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. weekdays, will be open from 9 a.m. to noon Saturday and until 7 p.m. Oct. 8.
Mail-in registration forms are available at all post offices, town and city halls, banks and public libraries, and the form can be downloaded from the Board of Election website at elections,niagara.ny.us.
